In the classic SIR model, each individual can be in three different states: infected ( I), susceptible ( S), and recovered ( R). In an epidemic spreading case, infected individuals ( I) can infect susceptible individuals ( S) through human contact network, while an infected individual can be cured and turn into recovery state ( R). Once an infectious disease starts to spread in a certain sub-network, due to the denseness of the sub-network nodes and the short distance between neighboring nodes, the epidemic will outbreak within the sub-network in a short time (
